Body:
I recently got myself a Raspberry Pi 3 model B, and wanted to get my feet wet with Windows 10 IoT by following some of the tutorials from Microsoft (in this case, Blinky).

I have however run into the issue that it always returns "There is no GPIO controller on this device."
column9: and I have no idea why
column10:
I have more than triple checked all the wiring to make sure that is not the issue.

Does anyone know why GpioController.GetDefault() returns null?

Googling my issue has sadly not given me any solution
column11: or even others with the same issue
column12:
so I imagine that it is likely some kind of error on my part but have no idea what.

"

Body: @ShannonHolsinger I've had no luck understanding any of those results, as from what I could ready, using windows 10 IoT on Raspberry Pi 3 should handle driver issues, and most other results from both of those google searches are for python projects, not C#.
General Purpose I/O https://www.google.com/?ion=1&espv=2#q=gpio%20controller you need to connect some sort of storage (or bios setting)
And methinks thou does not know Professor Google very well: https://www.google.com/?ion=1&espv=2#q=raspberry%20pi%20gpio%20error
My problem seems to have been related to Windows 10 IoT itself, after letting it update via the device portal, the GPIO works as outlined in the tutorial.
What build of WinIoT Core were you running when you had the issue?
The solution is, change the Default Controller Driver" to Inbox Driver from your windows device portal. to do this
column9:
go to "[windows 10 iot device ipaddress]:8080" in your browser. go to device tab. and select inbox driver.

"
